data.title: Installing Atom
data.body: Whenever I install Atom, then close it for later use, it deletes itself, and I have to re-download it again, I cannot search it up with Cortana or searching up the file, the only thing I see when I search up the file is the installer itself. Please help.

data.title: Atom cannot synchronize the view of the editor and the preview.
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When working with a Markdown preview to the side of your editor, atom cannot synchronize the view of the editor and the preview. By default, the Markdown preview will automatically scroll to reveal the element at the selected line in the editor.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

### Versions

Atom    : 1.21.0-beta2
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.

data.title: Fix mouseup listener cleanup when dragging in text editor
data.body: This listener is added with `{capture: true}`, which means it'll only be removed if `removeEventListener()` is passed `{capture: true}` too. Without that (as it is currently), the listener is never removed and each mouseup event ends up triggering the handler one more time than the last. Eventually, this leads to slowdown. ðŸ˜ž

data.title: Add git "stage updates" command
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

In the Git user interface in Atom, there is a command to "Stage All" which is equivalent to `git add --all`. It would be useful to have another command to "Stage Updates" similar to `git add --update` which will only stage files which are already under version control and have been modified.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a project with a git repository
2. Modify some version controlled files and create some new files
3. Open the git user interface

**Expected behavior:** A "Stage Update" command allows staging the modified files only, while "Stage All" does what it does currently.

**Actual behavior:** Only a "Stage All" command exists

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

Atom    : 1.19.2
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
Debian Sid

### Additional Information

None

data.title: Configure Atom to always open files in new windows
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

I'm trying out Atom as a replacement for some or all my current set of text editors and I immediately found one behaviour of Atom very annoying. It seems that there is currently no way to configure Atom to open files in a separate windows instead of an already existing one. 

This even happens when there's no Atom window in the current Space but there's one on another Space. Then I'm inadvertently switched to that other Space (which breaks my workflow) and the file is opened in a window there.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open one file from Finder
2. Open a second file from Finder

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

I now have two windows, each having one of the files opened.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

Both files are opened in a single window instead.

### Versions

I'm running OS X 10.11.6.

Atom    : 1.20.1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

data.title: Fix flaky package manager spec
data.body:
This fixes a flaky test: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/Atom/atom/build/7624/job/gsbcqdb2a8298xop

I also took this opportunity to convert the package manager spec to JavaScript and use `async` and `await` instead of `waitsFor`.

data.title: Atom lags and crashes with no crash report
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When using Atom, every 5 seconds the editor will lag for ~2 secs. (If I watch the cursor, it will blink 5 times, then pause 2, then start again.) Obviously see this when coding -- lag then type appears. If I leave the editor open, in the background while I'm working in other apps, it will eventually crash, after ~20mins.

Worth noting:
- I have latest stable release installed (1.20.1), with only the core packages installed and enabled.
- I've wiped my machine of Atom and all hidden files and reinstalled. Same result.
- I've tried safe mode. Same result.
- I've tried clearing saved state. Same result.
- I've reset to factory settings. Same result.
- Following a crash, I've looked in Console for a crash report. There is never one.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Start working in any file, or even just working in the app at all
3. Notice the lagging
4. Leave app open, wait for the crash after ~20 mins

**Expected behavior:** I would expect to work in the editor with no lag and no intermittent crashes.

**Actual behavior:** It lags every 5 secs, for 2 secs; crashes after being open for ~20 mins.

**Reproduces how often:** Every time I have it open.

### Versions

Atom    : 1.20.1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

### Additional Information

Video: Watch cursor then lag when typing.
https://bazaarvoice.box.com/s/9a10ulqdsak8i0e8ul5qbr1i3t8ffqzq

![screen shot 2017-09-28 at 1 53 53 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5889602/30986709-fa639dc2-a459-11e7-820f-f96de124dd52.png)

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

### Description

Cannot open a file when there is no window opened.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Close All Windows
3. Click on Â«File | Open File...Â» (or use the keyboard shortcut, "CMD+O" for me)

**Actual behavior:** Nothing actually happens

Node    : 7.4.0

python 2.7.10
git 2.8.1

data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/

    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description
Opening a path with a space in it fails.

[Description of the issue]

### Steps to Reproduce

```
$ mkdir -p 'path/with a space/to/my'
$ echo 'file contents' > 'path/with a space/to/my/file'
$ atom 'path/with a space/to/my/file'
```

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
atom opens with one tab showing content 'file contents'

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
atom opens with three empty tabs named "with", "a", "file"

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
100%

### Versions

Atom    : 1.20.1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

### Description

Atom editor renders random text over each other.

I am currently unable to get repro steps for this but have screenshots of the scenario

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Text should show up and other lines shouldn't be rendered on top

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Additional random lines are rendered above current lines and don't disappear after scrolling.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5624870/30943254-afe3ece4-a3a4-11e7-8b77-15f614f6a9d5.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5624870/30943260-b8698e5a-a3a4-11e7-8403-9f86de7c9055.png)


**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
I can't repro this again and unsure what I did to get to this scenario



### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.22.0-dev-1880e1401
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

```

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.

While scrolling you can see it updates the line numbers but there's additional lines that just stay there.
![scrolling](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5624870/30943263-c51f8cf8-a3a4-11e7-8586-70acac3ee53a.gif)

/CC @nathansobo @as-cii

data.title: Fix faded application icons on macOS 10.13
data.body:
### Description of the Change
Something changed in macOS 10.13 High Sierra that affects how our application icons render. Simply regenerating the `.icns` files based on the PNG master files using `iconutil` fixes the issue. I am however not able to verify if they still look as intended on macOS 10.12 (and older).

### Alternate Designs
Will have to ship separate icon set for macOS 10.13 if this does not work as intended on older releases of macOS.

### Why Should This Be In Core?
Icon resources reside in this repo.

### Benefits
Application icons look like they should â€” not washed out.

### Possible Drawbacks
Might break icons on macOS versions older than 10.13.

### Applicable Issues
Fixes #15410

data.title: Upgrade text-buffer and autosave to avoid spurious saves
data.body:
Refs https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/263
Refs https://github.com/atom/autosave/pull/84

This avoids unnecessarily saving files as soon as they are opened when autosave is enabled, while still keeping the changes that fix https://github.com/atom/autosave/issues/67.

data.title: Code Color lost in an Array with many Elements
data.body:
versions: **1.21.0-beta2** (Windows) and **1.17.2x64** (Linux)
language: **JavaScript**
When i type:
`let foo=[ "top","window","location","external","chrome","document","inlineCSS","target","width","height","canvas","data","DOMURL","img","svg","ctx","url","w","a","speechSynthesis","webkitNotifications","localStorage","sessionStorage","applicationCache","webkitStorageInfo","indexedDB","webkitIndexedDB","crypto","CSS","performance","console","devicePixelRatio","styleMedia","parent","opener","frames","self","defaultstatus","defaultStatus","status","name","length","closed","pageYOffset","pageXOffset","scrollY","scrollX"];`

If i type: **let foo=[** (without space) or **let foo =[** (whitout space between assigment and square brackets), after the 24 element, atom lost the visual color code:
![array-visual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4041664/30938400-44d5a288-a3b0-11e7-8cc9-87a34edfc532.png)

if i type: **let foo = [** appears normal:
![atom-normal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4041664/30938621-0fa43286-a3b1-11e7-88d7-4ac0ee1eb3ea.png)

data.title: MacOS - Only 1 launchpad icon when Atom & Atom Beta are installed side by side
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When you install Atom & Atom Beta side by side on MacOS the version you installed last is the icon that shows up in Launchpad. Both show up in the 'Applications' folder but I find Launchpad is an easier way to open programs that are not in my dock.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Atom
2. Install Atom beta
3. Open Launchpad

**Expected behavior:** 

To see a green Atom icon and a gold Atom Beta icon

**Actual behavior:**

The last version you install is the only icon that displays. So if I installed Atom and then Atom Beta all I see is the gold Atom Beta icon in Launchpad.

**Reproduces how often:**

Seems to be all the time.

### Versions

Atom: 1.20.1
Atom Beta: 1.21.0-beta2

### Additional Information

MacOS 10.13 High Sierra (although I noticed this happened on 10.12.x Sierra as well)

data.title: Find All links to file instead of lien in code
data.body:
The find all results no longer consistently link to the actual lines of code where the results were found (though the line numbers are identified).

![atom find all bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8753436/30918059-0f70e82a-a363-11e7-8e76-d80558e3c031.png)


**Steps to Reproduce:**
Press ctrl + shift + f to perform a search in all open files.
Do a search where an instance appears multiple times in a single file.
Click on a particular instance of the results.
Return to the results and click on another instance in that same file.

**Atom : 1.20.1 ia32**

data.title: CMD+SHIFT+E for populating replace field
data.body:
There is a keyboard shortcut CMD+E which puts the current selection into the search field in the search dialog -- this is a standard across all of OS X, and Atom implements it.

TextMate extended this by having CMD+SHIFT+E populate the replace field.

It's very handy, and it would be nice to have this in Atom.

data.title: Keybinding Resolving Incorrectly: shift-alt-b resolves to shift-I
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

I'm running into a problem where `shift-alt-b` resolves as `shift-i` within atom. It is not possible for the `shift-alt-b` key combination to resolve properly in my editor anywhere. This started occurring in the past week. It is only occurring in Atom as I have this globally setup as a keybinding on my Mac to be `select-backwards-by-word` via the KeyBindingsEditor app, and that is continuing to work globally (I have tried turned this off to confirm that it's no conflict). 

I've used the Keybinding Resolver to find out that `shift-alt-b` => `shift-i`, but now I'm stuck. Due to running in safe mode, I've confirmed this isn't a 3rd party package causing a problem. I'd like to debug this further, but I am not sure of what next steps to take. If someone can give me that next thing to try then I'd be happy to give it a go as this is an important keybinding in my workflow and it's driving me nuts. 

### Steps to Reproduce

I believe this to be a local issue with my machine, but in case it's not: 
1. Add the following to your keymap.cson: 
```coffeescript
'atom-workspace':
  'alt-shift-B': 'editor:select-to-beginning-of-word'
```
2. Try typing `shift-alt-b` in editor.
3. View in resolver that this resolves to `shift-I`

**Expected behavior:** I except my keybinding to work and have the correct keys resolved. 

**Actual behavior:** Resolving to incorrect keys. 

**Reproduces how often:** Consistently on my machine.

### Versions

```
 ~  Â» atom --version   
Atom    : 1.20.1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

 ~  Â» apm --version
apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.11.0
```

### Additional Information

I believe I've covered it all. Happy to provide any other info if needed. 

Thanks for the help!

data.title: Opening a file with a space in its name or in the path leading up to its name
data.body:
Running on Linux:

```
$ atom "/path/with a space/to/file.js"
```

fails. It opens three tabs: "/path/with", "a", "space/to/file.js".

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a javascript file with UTF8 encoding.
2. Convert to GBK encoding.
3. Convert to UTF8 encoding.
4. Loop ...
5. Sometimes happened


### Versions

**Atom**    : 1.20.1
**Electron**: 1.6.9
**Chrome**  : 56.0.2924.87
**Node**    : 7.4.0


**Script Language** javascript
